content.description:
This one is THE crack in this area! While not perfect it is quite good. The start involves face climbing in to thin fingers then perfect fingers up higher and finally a hard top section while you sry to clip the chains. The middle part is amazing 5.9 locks. 

  I was between 2 and 3 stars on this one but I went with 3 cause it is great, it just needs a good cleaning. 

  Its a little harder than Black Jack Crack so if that went well for you, step up to this!
content.protection: Small to medium nuts and cams.
content.location: The obvious center piece of the cracks, right up the center.

content.description: A small slab around the corner from the cracks.    It is fun though very short. This line is good way to get up to the top of the cliff to set up a top rope on the 5.11 cracks.
content.location: To the right of the cracks.

content.description:
This is the right angling crack on the right of the 3 crack system. Fun climbing, on good rock. Tough sections with good holds between. 

  As with the other lines it was hard to decide how independent the routes are supposed to be. They are so close. If i hadn't touched Grass Crack i felt this would have been 5.13 so i climbed up Grass to gain the right angling crack, climbed all the way over to the arete which was a fun section. Then i topped out independent from the other 2 lines, climbing straight up to a small tree then walked over to the anchor. 

  I had to clean it a little but it was pretty good. These will never be classics but if you like cracks and mixing it up a bit, get after em.
content.protection: TR or a dicey lead. I don't think it has been led though i would consider it, it doesn't seem like a death route.
content.location: the right hand right leaning crack.

content.description:
The left hand crack. Very thin, and pretty tough in the grade unless I'm missing something.  

  Thin protection and tough climbing through the first 2/3 of the route then it gets really hard and dirty of you break right in to Grass Crack to get to the anchor which seems to make sense.
Second "story" of the cliff on the right-most section above the Cave.
